--- title: "An introduction of the three main coffee chains in the world " author: "Xianghe" toc: true date: "2022-07-25" categories: [analysis, code] image: "map.jpg" ---
::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` ── Attaching packages ─────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.3.2 ── ✔ ggplot2 3.3.6 ✔ purrr 0.3.4 ✔ tibble 3.1.8 ✔ dplyr 1.0.9 ✔ tidyr 1.2.0 ✔ stringr 1.4.0 ✔ readr 2.1.2 ✔ forcats 0.5.1 ── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ── ✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() ✖ dplyr::lag() masks stats::lag() Attaching package: 'kableExtra' The following object is masked from 'package:dplyr': group_rows Attaching package: 'plotly' The following object is masked from 'package:ggplot2': last_plot The following object is masked from 'package:stats': filter The following object is masked from 'package:graphics': layout ``` ::: ::: ## Introduction Coffee is one of necessary in our everyday life. In every part of the world, in every culture, people drink coffee. Coffee is ubiquitous in modern society, it plays an vital role in our daily life; it gives people a good start of a day, providing energy to people throughout the work and also enriching people' spare time. ![](image2.jpg){fig-align="center"} The history of coffee can be traced hundreds of years ago, and it is becoming a common refreshment drink spreading around the world. Some people with industrious minds recognizes this widespread appeal, and the more of the entrepreneurs uses the opportunity to make coffee a commodity and selling around the world so that they could profit from. Today, we can see coffee chain coffeehouses in every corner of the world, this are the fruits of coffee entrepreneurs' hard work and labor in the numerous coffee chains that have taken root worldwide. There are countless of coffee chains around the world, this post will only analyse three of main coffee chains in the world, which are Starbucks, Tim Hortons and Dunkin' Donuts. The main focus of this post will be Starbucks and using Tim Hortons and Dunkin' Donuts as supplementary to the analysis. ## Data Description The data is stored in a XLSX file and contains three set of coffee chain data, which corresponding to Starbucks, Tim Hortons and Dunkin' Donuts respectively. __Starbucks, Tim Hortons and Dunkin' Donuts__, which are the three of main coffee chains in the world. The variables in each of coffee chain data set can be categorized into two groups; the business store detail (store name, store number and store phone number etc) and the geographical location information (i.e. address, postcode, city, country, longitude and latitude etc). The Starbucks data set contains __25600__ observations and __13__ variables, and it has included the Starbucks coffeehouses in __73__ countries. The Tim Hortons data set contains __4955__ observations and __6__ variables, and it contains only __2__ countries' coffeehouses data, which are USA and Canada. Similarly, the Dunkin' Donuts data set contains __4898__ observations and __22__ variables, and it contains only __1__ country' coffeehouses data, which is __USA__. ::: {.cell tbl-cap='_Dimension Table of the three coffee chainnn_'} ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
Dimension Starbucks Tim.Hortons Dunkin..Donuts
No. Observation 25600 4955 4898
No. Varable 13 6 22
No. Country 73 2 1
````` ::: ::: and data set also shows that the majority part of business are located in USA and Canada. Moreover, this coffee chain data also includes the coffee chain name, business name and some other location of each coffeehouse. The data source is from github [coffee chains](https://github.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/blob/master/data/2018/2018-05-07) data. ## Reference Wickham H, Averick M, Bryan J, Chang W, McGowan LD, François R, Grolemund G, Hayes A, Henry L, Hester J, Kuhn M, Pedersen TL, Miller E, Bache SM, Müller K, Ooms J, Robinson D, Seidel DP, Spinu V, Takahashi K, Vaughan D, Wilke C, Woo K, Yutani H (2019). “Welcome to the tidyverse.” _Journal of Open Source Software_, *4*(43), 1686. doi: 10.21105/joss.01686 (URL: https://doi.org/10.21105/joss.01686). Hao Zhu (2021). kableExtra: Construct Complex Table with 'kable' and Pipe Syntax. R package version 1.3.4. https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=kableExtra H. Wickham. ggplot2: Elegant Graphics for Data Analysis. Springer-Verlag New York, 2016. Hadley Wickham and Jennifer Bryan (2022). readxl: Read Excel Files. R package version 1.4.0. https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=readxl C. Sievert. Interactive Web-Based Data Visualization with R, plotly, and shiny. Chapman and Hall/CRC Florida, 2020.
